abstract.text: A configuration that describes a specific background appearance.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: Background configurations provide a lightweight way for you to create backgrounds for your views. Using a background configuration, you can obtain system default background styling for a variety of different view states. You apply background configurations directly to
or to cells, headers, and footers in
Create a background configuration with one of the default system styles.
Modify the configuration to match your view’s style if you need additional customization.
Set the view’s current background configuration to your configuration.

code: // Set a nil background color to use the view's tint color.

inlineContent.text: You can also start by creating an empty background configuration using
Each of the system background styles provides system default values for different configuration states (
). If you apply a background configuration to a view whose
, the system automatically updates the background configuration when the view’s state changes.
If you want additional customization beyond the system default values, you can choose to manually update the background configuration by overriding the view’s

code: // Get the system default background configuration for a plain style list cell in the current state.
// Customize the background color to use the tint color when the cell is highlighted or selected.
// Apply the background configuration to the cell.

inlineContent.text: When you apply a configuration to a view, UIKit performs the actual drawing and rendering of the background. When you use background configurations instead of rendering your own backgrounds, the system provides automatic view hierarchy management, support for interactive and interruptible animations and transitions, and performance optimizations.

abstract.text: A true value.
Construct and manage a graphical, event-driven user interface for your iOS, iPadOS, or tvOS app.
A configuration that describes a specific background appearance.
The color of the background.
The color transformer for resolving the background color.
The insets (or outsets, if negative) for the background and stroke, relative to the edges of the containing view.
Creates an empty background configuration with a transparent background and no default styling.
The preferred corner radius, using a continuous corner curve, for the background and stroke.
A custom view for the background.
The edges on which the configuration adds the containing view’s layout margins to the background insets.
The image displayed in the view’s background.
A property that determines the layout of a background image in a view when its bounds change.
Creates the default configuration you use to style a cell in an accompanied sidebar list.
Creates the default configuration you use to style a cell in a grouped list.
Creates the default configuration you use to style a grouped list header or footer.
Creates the default configuration you use to style a cell in a plain list.
Creates the default configuration you use to style a plain list header or footer.
Creates the default configuration you use to style a cell in a sidebar list.
Creates the default configuration you use to style a sidebar list header.
Generates the resolved background color for the specified tint color, using the background color and color transformer.
Generates the resolved stroke color for the specified tint color, using the stroke color and color transformer.
The color of the stroke.
The color transformer for resolving the stroke color.
The outset (or inset, if negative) for the stroke.
The width of the stroke.
Generates a configuration for the specified state by applying the configuration’s default values for that state to any properties that you haven’t customized.
The visual effect that the configuration applies to the background.
A control that executes your custom code in response to user interactions.
An object that manages an ordered collection of data items and presents them using customizable layouts.
A Boolean value that determines whether the cell automatically updates its background configuration when its state changes.
Updates the cell’s configuration using the current state.
The requirements for an object that encapsulates a view’s state.
A view that presents data using rows in a single column.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type that explicitly supplies its own mirror.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose values can be implicitly or explicitly copied.
